cleaned_text: COVID Vaccinations Health protocols - including vaccinations and the latest boosters - continue to be important for protecting ourselves and each other. Here are Stanford resources to help you learn more about COVID-19 vaccinations and how to obtain them. [Environmental Health & Safety](https://ehs.stanford.edu/topic/covid-19): Information on COVID-19 positive-case reporting and assistance, testing, masking, potential building exposure list, and submitting questions. [Cardinal at Work](https://cardinalatwork.stanford.edu/working-stanford/covid-19-workplace-guide): Information and guidance on COVID-19 employee workplace policies, resources, and assistance. - In alignment with [CDC recommendations](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?s_cid=11369:cdc%20children%20covid%20vaccine:sem.ga:p:RG:GM:gen:PTN:FY21), Stanford recommends everyone stay up to date with COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters. [Student Affairs](https://studentaffairs.stanford.edu/covid-guidance/covid-19-testing-vaccination-health-check): A quick guide to quarantine/isolation, masking, and testing for students who have tested positive, are symptomatic, or have been exposed.
